title: UNSW: A Top University Option for International Students
content: The University of New South Wales (UNSW) is ranked #20 globally (QS World University Rankings, 2024-2026) and #1 in Australia for employment outcomes (QS World University Rankings, 2026). Four UNSW subjects rank in the global top 20 (QS World University Rankings by Subject, 2025).

citations.quote: Ranked #20 globally in the QS World University Rankings, 2024–2026
Four subjects ranked in the top 20, QS World University Rankings by Subject, 2025
Ranked #1 in Australia for employment outcomes, QS World University Rankings, 2026
Offers to UNSW are based on academic merit.
We accept a number of international qualifications, including some international high school certificates.

title: Study in Australia: A Guide for Nepali Students
content: Post-study work rights extend up to 6 years. Scholarships are available. Six Australian cities rank in the top 50 student cities globally (QS Best Student Cities 2025). Nine Australian universities are in the global top 100 (QS World University Rankings 2025). Part-time work (up to 48 hours per fortnight) is allowed.

citations.quote: Australia remains a top destination for Nepalese students seeking high-quality education, offering diverse courses across fields like business, engineering, humanities, and language studies. With over 22,000 programs at 1,100 universities and institutions, students can earn globally recognised degrees while benefiting from a vibrant, supportive environment.
Student-friendly cities According to the QS Best Student Cities 2025, 6 of the top 50 student cities are in Australia.*
Post-study work rights: Australia offer up to 6 years of post-study work rights
World-recognised universities: Australia is known for its good quality education. According to the QS World University Rankings 2025, 9 of the top 100 universities are in Australia.*
Part-time Work: You can work part-time up to 48 hours per fortnight in Australia

title: Education Consultancy Services for Nepali Students
content: They have a high visa success rate and 750+ partner institutions. Free consultations with certified counsellors are available.

citations.quote: Courses, scholarships, study visa and 2025 deadlines — all in one place
Book your FREE consultation with Certified Counsellors

title: Pre-Application Preparation: Laying the Foundation for Australian Student Visa Success (Nepal)
content: For Nepali students aspiring to study in Australia, meticulous pre-application preparation is paramount. This stage involves selecting the right course and university, meeting academic and English language requirements, and understanding the visa application process. Start by researching courses aligned with your academic background and career goals. Australian universities provide detailed course information on their websites (e.g., [University of Sydney International Students](https://www.sydney.edu.au/study/international-students.html) (Accessed October 26, 2023)). Ensure you meet the entry requirements, including academic transcripts and English language proficiency tests like IELTS or PTE. The [Australian Department of Home Affairs website](https://immi.homeaffairs.gov.au/visas/getting-a-visa/visa-listing/student-500) (Accessed October 26, 2023) provides comprehensive visa information. Choose a course registered on the Commonwealth Register of Institutions and Courses for Overseas Students (CRICOS). This confirms the institution's legitimacy and quality.

title: Financial Planning and Demonstration: Proving Your Financial Capacity for Australian Studies
content:
Demonstrating sufficient funds to cover tuition, living expenses, and travel is crucial for Nepali students applying for an Australian student visa. The current visa application fee is AUD 650 (approximately NPR 57,000 at an exchange rate of 87.7 NPR/AUD as of October 26, 2023). Provide evidence of funds through bank statements, loan sanction letters, or scholarship awards. Calculate living expenses based on the Australian government's guidelines. Consider the cost of accommodation, food, transportation, health insurance (Overseas Student Health Cover - OSHC), and other personal expenses. Detailed information on financial requirements is available on the [Department of Home Affairs website](https://immi.homeaffairs.gov.au/visas/getting-a-visa/visa-listing/student-500) (Accessed October 26, 2023). A clear and organized presentation of financial documents significantly strengthens your application. - **Ward Verification Documents Required:**
  - Address verification certificate from local ward office
  - Name verification certificate
  - Income source verification
  - Birth certificate with ward office attestation
  - Family registration certificate
  - Property ownership verification (if applicable)

title: Document Organization and Presentation: Crafting a Compelling Visa Application
content:
A well-organized and presented application significantly improves your chances of visa approval. The Department of Home Affairs provides a document checklist on their website ([immi.homeaffairs.gov.au](https://immi.homeaffairs.gov.au/visas/getting-a-visa/visa-listing/student-500) (Accessed October 26, 2023)). Ensure all documents are certified copies. Nepal may require ward verification for certain documents. Organize your documents logically and use clear labels. A table of contents can further enhance clarity. Example:  1. Application Form, 2. Passport, 3. Academic Transcripts, 4. English Language Test Results, 5. Financial Documents, 6. Statement of Purpose, 7. Health Insurance, 8. Evidence of Welfare Arrangements (if applicable). - **Ward Verification Documents Required:**
  - Address verification certificate from local ward office
  - Name verification certificate
  - Income source verification
  - Birth certificate with ward office attestation
  - Family registration certificate
  - Property ownership verification (if applicable)
